DOC.brief_title: Obesity Intervention Low-Income African American Preschoolers
DOC.detailed_description: This study preliminarily validation parent-focused obesity intervention program parent low-income , African American preschooler currently overweight ( > 85th BMI % tile ) . Participants randomly assign intervention attention control condition . Those intervention receive intervention eight session length carry participant 's home . The session target nutrition physical activity knowledge parent motivation change parent related family eat habit activity level . Sessions include psycho-education skill building exercise . The attention comparison control condition ( ACCC ) participant receive one home visit , 7 newsletter 4 monthly support phone call . The content condition also focus nutrition activity knowledge , motivation parenting . Outcomes intervention ACC condition assess baseline , post-intervention 6-month 1-year followed . Child BMI % tile , consumption fruits/vegetables sugary beverage , activity level analyze examine intervention effectiveness across time .
DOC.criteria: Parents child enrol Head Start preschool Detroit , MI include . Parents must 18 year age old child must preschool age , 3 5 year age . Based recruitment Detroit Head Start , family lowincome African American descent . Children current body mass index percentile 85th percentile . Child BMI percentile 85th percentile .
